Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic Administrative Divisions:

Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republics

Autonomous Republics: Bashkir - Buryat - Checheno-Ingush - Chuvash - Dagestan - Kabardino-Balkar - Kalmyk - Karelian - Komi - Mari - Mordvinian -North Ossetian - Tatar - Tuvinan - Udmurt - Yakut - Former Autonomous Republics: Crimea -Kara-Kalpak - Kazakh - Kirghiz - Mountain (Gorskaya) - Volga German -Turkestan-

Note: The constitution of Russian S.F.S.R. of 1918 provided for the establishment of ethnic autonomous regional unions. Originally, each autonomous entity was dealt on a case by case basis. At the end of the Civil War in 1920, there were four Autonomous Socialist Soviet Republics. The Russian constitutions of 1925 and 1937 merely referred to the Autonomous Republics without defining their status, however the Autonomous Republics in their constitutions of 1937 were for the first time described as states. According to the Russian constitution of 1978, the Autonomous Republics, defined as states, made up the federation together with the Russian S.F.S.R. itself.

All autonomous republics that existed after 1920 are recorded below. By 1980, the Russian S.F.S.R. was divided into 87 entities (15 autonomous soviet socialist republics, 6 kraya, 49 oblasti, 2 cities of republican subordination, 5 autonomous oblasti, and 10 autonomous okruga). Until 1991, almost all leaders were members of the Communist Party so their party affiliations are generally not noted below. Non-Russian names of entities below are given in attempted transliteration of modern Cyrillic orthography of respective language. For the kraya, oblasti, cities of republican subordination, autonomous oblasti and autonomous okruga see RSFSR Admin. divisions Page 2 (from 25 Dec 1991 see Russia Administrative Divisions).

Party abbreviations: DR = Demokraticheskaya Rossiya (Democratic Russia, electoral bloc, 1990-2000); KPSS = Kommunisticheskaya Partiya Sovetskogo Soyuza (Communist Party of the Soviet Union, Marxist-Leninist communist, USSR state party to 13 Mar 1990, former VKP, 13 Oct 1952 - 29 Aug 1991); KPR = Kommunisticheskaya Partiya Rossiyskoy SFSR (Communist Party of the Russian SFSR, split from KPSS, 19 Jun 1990 - 6 Nov 1991; from 14 Feb 1993 Kommunisticheskaya Partiya Rossiyskoy Federatsii);

- Former parties: KPKF = Kommunisticheskaya Partiya Karelo-Finskoy S.S.R./Karjalais-Suomalaisen Sosialistisen Neuvostotasavallan Kommunistinen Puolue (Communist Party of the Karelo-Finnish S.S.R., former KPKF-B, 13 Oct 1952 - 25 Jul 1956, re-incorporated into VKP); KPKF-B = Kommunisticheskaya Partiya (Bol'shevikov) Karelo-Finskoy S.S.R./Karjalais-Suomalaisen Sosialistisen Neuvostotasavallan Kommunistinen Puolue (Bolevikit)(Communist Party [Bolsheviks] of the Karelo-Finnish S.S.R., separated from VKP, 27 Apr 1940-13 Oct 1952, renamed KPKF);NSPKB = Natsional-Sotsialisticheskaya Partiya Severokavkazskikh Brat'yev (National-Socialist Party of North Caucasian Brothers, militant Chechen nationalist, anti-communist, 28 Jan 1942-1942);PSR = Partiya Sotsialistov-Revolyutsionerov (Party of Socialists-Revolutionaries, "SRs", democratic socialist, agrarian socialist, split Aug 1917 into Left and Right wings, 1902-1922);RKP = Rossiyskaya Kommunisticheskaya Partiya (Bol'shevikov)(Russian Communist Party [Bolsheviks], Marxist-Leninist communist, state party, former RSDRP-B, 8 Mar 1918-31 Dec 1925, renamed VKP);VKP = Vsesoyuznaya Kommunisticheskaya Partiya (Bol'shevikov)(All-Union Communist Party [Bolsheviks], Marxist-Leninist communist, USSR state party, former RKP, 31 Dec 1925-13 Oct 1952, renamed KPSS)

kraya, oblasti, autonomous oblasti and autonomous okruga: see part 2

Volga Germans

1927 - 29 Apr 1937

29 Apr 1937 - 7 Sep 1941

19 Oct 1918 Labor Commune of the Germans of the Volga (Trudovaya Kommuna Nemtsev

Povolzh'ya/Arbeitskommune der Wolgadeutschen)(also from c.1920,

called Autonomous Oblast of the Volga Germans [Avtonomnaya oblast'

Nemtsev Povolzh'ya/Autonomen Gebiet) der Wolgadeutschen]), created

from part of Saratov and Samara Governorates, within the

Russian S.F.S.R. 6 Jan 1924 Autonomous Socialist Soviet Republic of the Volga Germans

(Autonomen Sozialistischen Raete-Republik der Wolgadeutschen/

Avtonomnaya Sovetskaya Sotsialisticheskaya Respublika Nemtsev

Povolzh'ya), within Russian S.F.S.R.28 Jun 1928 - 10 Jan 1934 Within the Lower Volga (Nizhnevolzhskiy) Kray.

10 Jan 1934 - 5 Dec 1936 Within Saratov Kray.

5 Dec 1936 Renamed Volga German Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic (Autonome

Sozialistische Sowjetrepublik der Wolgadeutschen/Avtonomnaya

Sovetskaya Sotsialisticheskaya Respublika Nemtsev Povolzh'ya),

within Russian S.F.S.R.7 Sep 1941 Dissolved and divided between Saratov and Stalingrad oblasti;

the German residents are expelled to Central Asia.
